poem:
Title: A Symphony of Sisterhood

Five notes forming a sisterhood, crescendo in her story.
Protective pulse, the leader's drum, her director's glory.
In Compton's cradle, a happy child, with dreams beyond the fray.
In shades of black, a girl's heart blooms, lighting DuVernay's way.
A symphony shaping its conductor, tender yet ablaze,
She strides in her own film-score, sketching life in her distinctive phrase.
